result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre D. Farland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete a 24- or 26-week domestic abuse education class.

Pay costs of supervision and court costs.  (Court costs have been taken out of the cash bond; balance due to the Court is $0. See assessment report.)

Credit in the event of revocation stipulated at 0 days.

Upon successful completion of probation, Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 and should follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre D. Farland

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andre D. Farland in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA informs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to count 2/dc for probation of 18 months.  Def pleads no contest to count 2.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 18 months probation - d.a. class; first offender's treatment per 973.015 upon succ. completion of probation; pay costs.  Count 1 dismissed/read in.  Credit in the event of revocation:  0 days.

Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel in court for Defendant Andre D. Farland. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Andre D. Farland in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. N requests further status.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Andre D. Farland not in court; appearing by attorney Robert Franklin Nagel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. N requests additional status Nov. 4th when he's back on other matters.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel in court for Defendant Andre D. Farland. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andre D. Farland not in court.  Formal reading waived.  NG pleas entered on def's behalf.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
No contact amended to be: "No contact except for the sole purpose of child exchanges".

Defendant Andre D. Farland in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Formal reading waived. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties as well as right to counsel. Def does not qualify for SPD or court-appointed counsel. Def requests time to seek counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm. DA requests bond amendment for "no contact except for the sole purpose of exchanging their child"
